title: Definitions
context: ARTICLE 7. SUPPORT PROCEEDING UNDER CONVENTION Note Article heading amended by L 2015, c 77, pt of ยง1. ยง576B-701 Definitions. As used in this article unless the context otherwise requires: &ldquo;Application&rdquo; means a request under the Convention by an obligee or obligor, or on behalf of a child, made through a central authority for assistance from another central authority. &ldquo;Central authority&rdquo; means the entity designated by the United States or a foreign country described in paragraph (4) of the definition of &ldquo;foreign country&rdquo; in section 576B-102 to perform the functions specified in the Convention. &ldquo;Convention support order&rdquo; means a support order of a tribunal of a foreign country described in paragraph (4) of the definition of &ldquo;foreign country&rdquo; in section 576B-102. &ldquo;Direct request&rdquo; means a petition filed by an individual in a tribunal of this State in a proceeding involving an obligee, obligor, or child residing outside the United States. &ldquo;Foreign central authority&rdquo; means the entity designated by a foreign country described in paragraph (4) of the definition of &ldquo;foreign country&rdquo; in section 576B-102 to perform the functions specified in the Convention. &ldquo;Foreign support agreement&rdquo;: (1) Means an agreement for support in a record that: (A) Is enforceable as a support order in the country of origin; (B) Has been: (i) Formally drawn up or registered as an authentic instrument by a foreign tribunal; or (ii) Authenticated by, or concluded, registered, or filed with a foreign tribunal; and &copy; May be reviewed and modified by a foreign tribunal; and (2) Includes a maintenance arrangement or authentic instrument under the Convention. &ldquo;United States central authority&rdquo; means the Secretary of the United States Department of Health and Human Services. [L 1997, c 295, pt of ยง1; am L 2015, c 77, pt of ยง1]
